greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k), n>=1, 1<=k<=n, read by rows, where sequence a_k of column k has a_k(0)=1, followed by (k-1)-fold 0 and a_k(n) shifts k places down under binomial transform.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..141, flattened
formula: T(n,k) = Sum_{j=0..n-k} C(n-k,j)*T(j,k) if n>=k, else T(n,k) = 1 if n=1, else T(n,k) = 0.
mathematica: t[n_, k_] := t[n, k] = If[n < k, If[n == 0, 1, 0], Sum[Binomial[n-k, j]*t[j, k], {j, 0, n-k}]]; Table[Table[t[n, k], {k, 1, n}], {n, 1, 13}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 18 2013, translated from Maple *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 06 2008
